com.example.crossfire

Class Shield

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.crossfire.Shield
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject

    public class Shield
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameObject
    Shield is a game object and each Turret has an instance of a shield. Shield update() and draw() are called from the Turret class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shield(float xCenter, float yCenter)
      Constructs a shield given its X and Y starting coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
      Draws the shield on the gamepanel canvas
      int getHeight()
      Returns the integer value of the shield's height
      android.graphics.Rect getShieldHitBox()
      Returns the Rect hitbox of the shield
      int getWidth()
      Returns the integer value of the shield's width
      float getxCenter()
      Returns the X coordinate of the center of the shield
      float getyCenter()
      Returns the Y coordinate of the center of the shield
      void setHeight(int height)
      Sets the height of the shield
      void setShieldHitBox(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
      Sets the hitbox of the shield given the left, right, top, and bottom values of its position
      void setWidth(int width)
      Sets the width of the shield
      void setxCenter(float xCenter)
      Sets the X coordinate of the center of the shield
      void setyCenter(float yCenter)
      Sets the Y coordinate of the center of the shield
      void update(int frameCount)
      Updates the position of the shield baseon on the new xCenter and yCenter values sent by the left joystick of the gameactivity

        public void setShieldHitBox(int left,
                            int top,
                            int right,
                            int bottom)
        Sets the hitbox of the shield given the left, right, top, and bottom values of its position
        Parameters:
        left - Coordinate of the left edge of the shield's hitbox
        top - Coordinate of the top edge of the shield's hitbox
        right - Coordinate of the right edge of the shield's hitbox
        bottom - Coordinate of the bottom edge of the shield's hitbox
